flawed_nl_solution:
First, you have to add the number of students that liked the three other fruits. Therefore, you have to add 70 + 120 + 147. This gives you a sum of 373.
We know that 450 students were interviewed, so you have to subtract 373 from 450 to get the number of students who liked strawberries. 450 - 373 = <<450-373=77>>77 students liked strawberries best out of all of the fruits.
#### 77

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 337, not 373. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
